content:
I have a finset α and I would like to obtain a finset (list α) of all permutations of the original set.

I know of two bad ways of doing this, both going via lists. finset.to_list requires noncomputable. finset.sort introduces extra requirements on α, and is also quite silly.

I also see that perms_of_finset exists, which looks promising! However it returns finset (equiv.perm α) which I'm a little out of my depth on understanding. I'm not sure whether this is remotely the right operation, and if it is I'm not sure how I would go about obtaining a list from it.

What's the best way to define this?
Oh! I missed that. Very nice, thanks for your help @Junyan Xu.
Sam has marked this topic as resolved.
